Package api

Interface dw_graph_algorithms

All Known Implementing Classes:
DWGraph_Algo
public interface dw_graph_algorithms
This interface represents a Directed (positive) Weighted Graph Theory Algorithms including: 0. clone(); (copy) 1. init(graph); 2. isConnected(); // strongly (all ordered pais connected) 3. double shortestPathDist(int src, int dest); 4. List shortestPath(int src, int dest); 5. Save(file); // JSON file 6. Load(file); // JSON file
Author:
boaz.benmoshe

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    directed_weighted_graph copy()
    Compute a deep copy of this weighted graph.
    directed_weighted_graph getGraph()
    Return the underlying graph of which this class works.
    void init​(directed_weighted_graph g)
    Init the graph on which this set of algorithms operates on.
    boolean isConnected()
    Returns true if and only if (iff) there is a valid path from each node to each other node.
    boolean load​(java.lang.String file)
    This method load a graph to this graph algorithm.
    boolean save​(java.lang.String file)
    Saves this weighted (directed) graph to the given file name - in JSON format
    java.util.List<node_data> shortestPath​(int src, int dest)
    returns the the shortest path between src to dest - as an ordered List of nodes: src--> n1-->n2-->...dest see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shortest_path_problem Note if no such path --> returns null;
    double shortestPathDist​(int src, int dest)
    returns the length of the shortest path between src to dest Note: if no such path --> returns -1

      Compute a deep copy of this weighted graph.
      Returns:

    • isConnected

      boolean isConnected()
      Returns true if and only if (iff) there is a valid path from each node to each other node. NOTE: assume directional graph (all n*(n-1) ordered pairs).
      Returns:

    • shortestPathDist

      double shortestPathDist​(int src, int dest)
      returns the length of the shortest path between src to dest Note: if no such path --> returns -1
      Parameters:
      src - - start node
      dest - - end (target) node
      Returns:

    • shortestPath

      java.util.List<node_data> shortestPath​(int src, int dest)
      returns the the shortest path between src to dest - as an ordered List of nodes: src--> n1-->n2-->...dest see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shortest_path_problem Note if no such path --> returns null;
      Parameters:
      src - - start node
      dest - - end (target) node
      Returns:

    • save

      boolean save​(java.lang.String file)
      Saves this weighted (directed) graph to the given file name - in JSON format
      Parameters:
      file - - the file name (may include a relative path).
      Returns:
      true - iff the file was successfully saved

    • load

      boolean load​(java.lang.String file)
      This method load a graph to this graph algorithm. if the file was successfully loaded - the underlying graph of this class will be changed (to the loaded one), in case the graph was not loaded the original graph should remain "as is".
      Parameters:
      file - - file name of JSON file
      Returns:
      true - iff the graph was successfully loaded.
